response.answer_text: You mean Denisovan and Neanderthals, etc? To know that you would need to search in places where only people who have inherited their introgressed genes can function normally, such as the Sherpa lands of the Himalayas. We would need to bulldoze most of the Amazon, Papua New Guinea, the Congo, and the 1/3 of North America that we can’t field explore. But probably so. If you consider Australopithecus to be a caveman, we’ve already found some. They’re called Bili Apes, and they’re only slightly more related to Chimps and Bonobos than we are.

If you mean men who live in caves, yes. Millions of people, in fact. Most are in China, but I have seen amazing pictures from Turkey as well. Note: these caves do have electricity, etc. Why the people of Pinglu, really dig their houses
